pullRequest.body:
added an optional type argument to SimpType; changed type inference in elementwise tactic

Co-authored-by: Kim Morrison <kim@tqft.net>

---

nodes.body:
I'll add a test to this before we merge.

This mistake in elementwise was causing it to produces lots of incorrect lemmas. The problem was that we were running `inferType` on the proof, which often disagrees with the expected type signature of the lemma we are making an auxiliary copy of.

:v: rmbellovin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Sorry, yes, we made the change in `simpType` when at first we thought we needed a deeper fix. I'll make the suggested changes.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9359278310/job/25762718696)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9359278310/job/25762718585)

I guess the `simpType` change is independent of the change to `@[elementwise]`? I'm not sure `simpType` needs to be changed (a user can use `mkExpectedTypeHint`) but it doesn't hurt being able to pass in the type to save a type hint.

The change to `@[elementwise]` looks good to me. Once you address the comment about `simpType`, feel free to merge.

bors d+

I guess the `simpType` change is independent of the change to `@[elementwise]`? I'm not sure `simpType` needs to be changed (a user can use `mkExpectedTypeHint`) but it doesn't hurt being able to pass in the type to save a type hint.

The change to `@[elementwise]` looks good to me. Once you address the comment about `simpType`, feel free to merge.

bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion def simpType (S : Expr MetaM Simp.Result) (e : Expr) (typeHint : Option Expr := none) : ```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix(Tactic/Elementwise): type inference in elementwise

nodes.body:
I'll add a test to this before we merge.

This mistake in elementwise was causing it to produces lots of incorrect lemmas. The problem was that we were running `inferType` on the proof, which often disagrees with the expected type signature of the lemma we are making an auxiliary copy of.

I guess the `simpType` change is independent of the change to `@[elementwise]`? I'm not sure `simpType` needs to be changed (a user can use `mkExpectedTypeHint`) but it doesn't hurt being able to pass in the type to save a type hint.

The change to `@[elementwise]` looks good to me. Once you address the comment about `simpType`, feel free to merge.

bors d+

:v: rmbellovin can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Sorry, yes, we made the change in `simpType` when at first we thought we needed a deeper fix. I'll make the suggested changes.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9359278310/job/25762718585)
